reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place does feel like your back on a school trip however its a good place! 2min walk to the main beach, friendly staff! and a 24hour kitchen for late night munchies!
reviews.title: Back to School

reviews.text: The kitchen was a bit messy but this was more to do with no one washing and drying! The room we were in was tiny! i think it would have suited at max a double bed but there
reviews.title: Decent, but needs some work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was 4 of us in there! Felt a bit too cramped! Good common room as well! Big problem was that the reception was constantly queued up, i know it was the start of Summer but 2 is definitly needed on reception! Easy to walk to the bars near by - a good place to come after Sydney! Also take the Hunter Valley wine tour through the hostel it was great!
reviews.title: Very hot with lots of Mosquitos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and the building has lots of character. Staff were always pleasant to deal with, and there's an overall relaxed atmosphere with everybody there.
reviews.title: The people couldn't have been friendlier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lounge/TV area is the nicest area inside, with high ceilings and a bunch of fans for good airflow. Bathrooms were bright and clean. I stayed in 3 different rooms, all of which were different. The only airflow was what came through the window(s), so it got uncomfortably sticky at night. Construction on a highrise across the street would begin at 6:30am, so noise would wake you up with the windows open. Bed sheets were pretty old & grotty and need to be replaced. Same goes for the drapes.
reviews.title: A good YHA

reviews.text: This is a great hostel for travellers. Great location so close to downtown and the beach great price, free dinners and events, large kitchen, clean rooms and a friendly fun vibe! I would recommend to all travellers!
reviews.title: Overall a great hostel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at this YHA. Close to the beach and street with shops around the corner. If you take a walk along the beach you get great vieuws of the cliffs and ocean.
reviews.title: Good YHA, needs an update

reviews.text: The YHA is in an old building that used to be occupied by nurses who worked in the local hospital. It gives you a nice feeling but it can use a bit of an update. The rooms are very old-fashioned. Big kitchen in the basement with loads of storage place. They organize pizza nights ect. Had a good time good hostel for YHA standards
reviews.title: Probably the best hostel in Australia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even if Newcastle doesn't excite you as a city, book a week at this hostel - I cannot recommend it enough. The building is beautiful and right next to a stunning bit of coastline. The atmosphere here is wonderful and there are free events on most nights with quiz evenings and FREE FOOD!!! Which is pretty unheard of at other YHAs and really great fun.
reviews.title: Gorgeous building, excellent staff, great location.

reviews.text: The only slight criticism is the bedrooms that are a bit dated and could use a freshen up, but otherwise we absolutely loved this place and would recommend it without reservation to absolutely everyone!
reviews.title: Basic but clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hostel, clean and in a pretty good location. But (and this is very picky, I know) because the lounge is so nice, it's a shame the rooms and kitchen are so bland-looking. Still, a very good hostel.
reviews.title: Nice, clean place

likes.disliked: — A bit of a trek to get to the town, although that's more the fault of the town planners!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Newcastle Beach YHA is contained in a lovely listed building which oozes charm. Our double room was enormous, with large bay windows ensuring it got plenty of light and from which we could see the sea. The hostel has some great communal areas- large leather sofas, wood-panelled walls and an open fireplace making for an altogether unique hostel experience. The bathrooms were clean, though nothing to write home about. The communal kitchen was large, although we happened upon a cockroach on our last night, which knocks off a star. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice, unique place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here in January 08, and found it a really nice hostel.
reviews.title: Really Nice Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Quirky building with lots of character and helpful staff

reviews.title: Fantastic Place and Fantastic People
reviews.text: the building has loads of character - i think the staff told us it used to be a halls of residence for young nurses; it's a huge rambling place with some great communal areas (a very grand living room and a nice basement kitchen with lots of fridge space and loads of tables for meals).
